com.aurel.track.admin.server.siteConfig

Class SiteConfigAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.opensymphony.xwork2.ActionSupport
      • com.aurel.track.admin.server.siteConfig.SiteConfigAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.opensymphony.xwork2.Action, com.opensymphony.xwork2.LocaleProvider, com.opensymphony.xwork2.Preparable, com.opensymphony.xwork2.TextProvider, com.opensymphony.xwork2.Validateable, com.opensymphony.xwork2.ValidationAware, java.io.Serializable, org.apache.struts2.interceptor.ApplicationAware, org.apache.struts2.interceptor.ServletResponseAware, org.apache.struts2.interceptor.SessionAware

    public class SiteConfigAction
extends com.opensymphony.xwork2.ActionSupport
implements com.opensymphony.xwork2.Preparable, org.apache.struts2.interceptor.SessionAware, org.apache.struts2.interceptor.ApplicationAware, org.apache.struts2.interceptor.ServletResponseAware
    Implementation of SiteConfigAction that processes the site configuration requests

      • execute

                         throws java.lang.Exception
        This routine is being called after prepare() in case of GET, e.g. before the load action

      • load

        public java.lang.String load()
        This is the load action. It prints a suitable JSON object directly into the response stream. The site and application have already been loaded by the prepare method.
        Returns:
        usually nothing, response is directly printed into the response stream. Can also throw back to logon page in case of insufficient authorization.

      • save

        public java.lang.String save()
        This saves the server configuration coming from the user interface to the database. Some validation is performed when it cannot be directly done at the user interface.
        Returns:
        usually nothing, output is directly printed into response stream

      • clearSMTPPassword

        public java.lang.String clearSMTPPassword()
        This action clears the SMTP password.
        Returns:
        usually nothing, output is directly printed into response stream

      • testOutgoingEmail

        public java.lang.String testOutgoingEmail()
        This action tests if outgoing e-mail connection is configured correctly.
        Returns:
        nothing, writes directly into the response stream.

      • testLdap

        public java.lang.String testLdap()
        This action tests if LDAP is configured correctly.
        Returns:
        nothing, writes directly into the response stream.
